com.analog.lyric.dimple.model.core

Interface INode

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IDimpleEventSource, com.analog.lyric.util.misc.IGetId, IModelEventSource, INameable, IOptionHolder
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Bit, BlastFromThePastFactor, Complex, Discrete, DiscreteFactor, Factor, FactorBase, FactorGraph, FiniteFieldVariable, MultiplexerCPD, Node, Real, RealJoint, Variable, VariableBase

    public interface INode
extends INameable, IModelEventSource
    Base interface for model components.
    Since:
    0.06 - extends IModelEventSource.

      • getSiblings

        java.util.List<? extends INode> getSiblings()
        Returns an unmodifiable list of sibling nodes attached to this node. This may allocate a new object, so the caller should avoid calling this repeatedly for the same node in a loop.
        See Also:
        getSiblingCount(), getSibling(int)

      • getSiblingCount

        int getSiblingCount()
        Returns the size of the getSiblings() list but without allocating any temporary objects.

      • getSibling

        INode getSibling(int i)
        Returns the ith element of the getSiblings() list but without allocating any temporary objects.

      • connect

        void connect(INode node)
        Adds node as a sibling of this node.

        Note that this does not perform the converse operation so to connect two nodes to each other you need to invoke this on each of them: 

            node1.connect(node2);
    node2.connect(node1);

      • disconnect

        void disconnect(int index)
        Removes sibling node with given index from list of siblings.

        Note that as with connect(INode), this does not perform the converse operation.

        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is not in the range [0,getSiblingCount()-1].
        See Also:
        disconnect(INode)

      • disconnect

        void disconnect(INode node)
        Removes sibling node from list of siblings.

        Note that as with connect(INode), this does not perform the converse operation.

        Throws:
        DimpleException - if node is not a sibling of this node.
        See Also:
        disconnect(int)

      • getAncestorAtHeight

        @Nullable
FactorGraph getAncestorAtHeight(int height)
        Returns the ancestor of this node at the specified height, where height zero refers to the immediate parent of the node returned by hasParentGraph(). Returns null if height is greater than the distance between this node and the root graph.

        When this returns a non-null value, then the following should be true: 

            n.getDepthBelowAncestor(n.getAncestorAtHeight(h)) == h
        See Also:
        getDepthBelowAncestor(com.analog.lyric.dimple.model.core.FactorGraph)

      • getDepth

        int getDepth()
        Returns the node's depth below the root FactorGraph, the number of graphs visited when walking through the chain of getParentGraph()s.

      • getDepthBelowAncestor

        int getDepthBelowAncestor(FactorGraph ancestor)
        Returns the depth of the node relative to the given ancestor. It is the number of graphs between the node and the ancestor graph when walking through the chain of getParentGraph(). Returns 0 if ancestor is parent of this node. Returns the negative depth minus one if ancestor is not an ancestor of this node.

        When this returns a non-negative value, then the following should be true: 

           n.getAncestorAtHeight(n.getDepthBelowAncestor(g)) == g
        See Also:
        getAncestorAtHeight(int)

      • isMarked

        @Internal
boolean isMarked()
        Boolean utility value that can be used to mark node has having been processed.

        False by default and reset by initialize().

        Since:
        0.05
        See Also:
        clearMarked(), setMarked()

      • wasVisited

        @Internal
boolean wasVisited()
        Boolean utility value that can be used to indicate node has been visited.

        False by default and reset by initialize().

        Since:
        0.05
        See Also:
        clearVisited(), setVisited()
